text: Is it correct to inherit from built-in classes?
I want to parse an Apache access.log file with a python program in a certain way, and though I am completely new to object-oriented programming, I want to start doing it now.
I am going to create a class ApacheAccessLog, and the only thing I can imagine now, it will be doing is 'readline' method.
Is it conventionally correct to inherit from the builtin file class in this case, so the class will behave just like an instance of the file class itself, or not?
What is the best way of doing that?
